com.navis.framework.persistence

Class IndexManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.IndexManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IIndexManager

    public final class IndexManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IIndexManager
    This class search for missed indexes and creates them based on Hibernate mapping files definitions. This is assigned to eliminate upgrade actions in order to add indexes It also contains methods to add/drop ICarinaIndex objects This method manage indexes in the database (vs. IndexLoader - in HBM files)
    Author:
    Andrey Ignatenko, May 21, 2009

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.navis.framework.persistence.IIndexManager

      boolean addIndex(ICarinaIndex inIndex)
      This adds an index to the database, corresponding to the inIndex Object
      boolean addIndex(java.lang.String inTableName, java.lang.String inIndexName, java.lang.String[] inColumnNames)
      This is backdoor method to add and index for testing purposes DO NOT USE THIS METHOD IN APPLICATION TO ADD AN INDEX!!!
      void addIndexes(java.util.List<ICarinaIndex> inIndexes)
      This method adds list of indexes into a database
      void addMissedIndexes(java.util.List<ICarinaIndex> inMissedIndexes)
      This method finds missed indexes (single and multicolumn) and creates them This eliminates upgrade actions to add indexes

      This drops an index from the database, corresponding to the inIndex Object

      • getMissedIndexesToAdd

        @NotNull
public java.util.List<ICarinaIndex> getMissedIndexesToAdd()
        Specified by:
        getMissedIndexesToAdd in interface IIndexManager
        Returns:
        list of indexes which declared in HBM file but don't exist in the database and could be added. This list doesn't include spatial indexes that cannot be added on the application startup.
